item.title: Neon Abyss 2 announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/neon-abyss-2-announced-for-pc

  • PC

Due out in Early Access in 2025.

Chinese developer Veewo Games has announced side-scrolling roguelike action game sequel Neon Abyss 2. It will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam in 2025.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Dive deeper into the chaotic, beautifully pixelated Abyss with Neon Abyss 2! The action is faster, the stakes are higher, and the possibilities are endless in this cybermyth roguelike. With explosive run-and-gun gameplay, diverse combat styles, and unlimited item synergies, Neon Abyss 2 delivers a dramatic, thrill-packed experience every time you enter.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Key Features

  • Unimaginable Weaponry: Revolutionary Weapon System – What’s your combat style? Smash enemies up close with a bat or saber, unleash attacks with deadly plants, or command fierce dragon-like creatures to fight for you—the choice is yours! With limitless options and imaginative weapons, every run lets you experiment with unique, wild ways to conquer the Abyss.
  • Unlimited Item Synergies: Even More Monstrous! – Random item drops in the Abyss grant you powers that combine in surprising and powerful ways. Stack as many as you can to create wild, unstoppable synergies that make every run feel unique. Show the Abyss who’s really in charge—there’s no limit to how many items you can wield!
  • Hatch Them All! Hatchmon! I Choose Your! – Your favorite Abyss companions, now in even brighter colors! Hatch and collect these cute creatures, then evolve them into powerful and unique allies to spice up your runs. With a variety of Hatchmon to discover, each run brings new possibilities!
  • The Power of Faith: Turn the Tides! – Introducing the all-new Faith System, designed to turn the tides when the Abyss gets unreasonable. How will you wield this power? Spend it in a shop stocked with powerful items, recruit more Hatchmon to fight by your side, or…risk it all in a game of chance? Either way, we have faith in you!
  • …And More! Discover As You Explore – Uncover a host of new features and surprises in this dynamic second installment. From new enemies and powerful gods to updated loot and hidden secrets, there’s always something fresh to find. The Abyss awaits—dive deeper and uncover secrets you may not face alone!

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

Announce Trailer

item.title: Word game LOK Digital for PC now available
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/word-game-lok-digital-for-pc-now-available

  • PC
  • Smartphone

Learn a cryptic language of world-changing words.

Publisher Draknek & Friends and developers Letibus Design and Icedrop Games have released word game LOK Digital for PC via Steam and itch.io for $14.99 with a 10 percent-off launch discount, the companies announced. iOS and Android versions are due out in early 2025.

Here is an overview of the game, via Draknek & Friends:

About

Learn the rules as you go and uncover how each new word has its own special ability to change the world around you in deep and surprising ways. Expand your vocabulary through 15 distinct worlds, each one exploring a new mechanic and completely shaking up the way you solve puzzles.

With approachable mechanics and mind-bending gameplay, LOK Digital invites you to return every day for new procedurally generated puzzles showcasing the breadth and depth of mechanics.

Bring the LOK creatures to life by spelling words that shape their world. They can only live on blackened tiles, so by solving puzzles you’re expanding their horizons and helping their civilization thrive.

Key Features

  • Intuitive mechanics and many magical words to find and learn.
  • Elegant, hand-drawn art style and meditative, entrancing soundtrack.
  • Learn the nuances of the LOK language across the 150-plus puzzle campaign.
  • Demonstrate your mastery of the mechanics in the expertly crafted daily puzzle mode and compete on the leaderboards.
  • Go up against friends, family and the world in the daily leaderboards.
  • Based on the critically acclaimed puzzle book, LOK.
  • Published by the award-winning puzzle experts, Draknek & Friends, the team behind A Monster’s Expedition, Cosmic Express, Bonfire Peaks, and more.

Watch the launch trailer below.

Launch Trailer

item.title: Time-bending puzzle platformer RECUR announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/time-bending-puzzle-platformer-recur-announced-for-pc

Publisher Astra Logical and developer kaleidoscube have announced RECUR, a puzzle platformer in which players can rewind, fast-forward, and pause time. It will launch for PC via Steam in 2026.

“We are super excited to finally show what we have been working on intensely for over two years,” said kaleidoscube managing director Dominik Schon in a press release. “In fact, our first prototypes for this game date back to 2017—it’s amazing to finally see it all come together.”

Schon continued, “What excites us most about the game mechanic in RECUR is how we can use it on a small scale for each individual puzzle, but also on a large scale when walking through the city and experiencing the recurring catastrophe.”

Astra Logical managing director Heather Jackson added, “We’re so proud to help bring RECUR to life and share it with players. Day of the Devs gave us the perfect platform to showcase the game, and the feedback we’ve received has been incredible. We can’t wait to let players dive into this story and experience the world kaleidoscube has built!”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via Astra Logical:

About

RECUR challenges players to think beyond reflexes, combining classic platforming gameplay with intricate puzzles that harness the power to rewind, fast-forward, and pause time itself. Players will explore richly designed environments, unravel the secrets behind their powers, and strive to put a world on the brink back together—one moment at a time.

Key Features

  • You’re just an average postman, but today is anything but average: It’s the end of the world and you suddenly find yourself able to control the flow of time itself.
  • You need more than just reflexes to save the world: You’ll need to use your new time-bending abilities to solve puzzles and traverse obstacles.
  • Explore a world falling apart in your quest to put things right. Or left.
  • How did you get your powers? Why is the world ending? Unravel the secrets of RECUR as you discover a rich and engaging story, brought to you by the team behind “A Juggler’s Tale”.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

Announce Trailer

item.title: Bike-racing party game Ultimate Sheep Raccoon announced for consoles, PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/bike-racing-party-game-ultimate-sheep-raccoon-announced-for-consoles-pc

Clever Endeavour Games has announced bike-racing party game Ultimate Sheep Raccoon for unspecified consoles and PC (Steam). It will launch in 2025.

Here is an overview of the game, via Clever Endeavour Games:

About

Race to victory through a mayhem-filled obstacle course of deadly traps you’ve built with friends while pulling off sick tricks!

Ultimate Sheep Raccoon is a bike-racing party game where you and your friends build a course of ramps, obstacles, and traps! Dodge hazards, do crazy tricks, and use power-ups to get ahead of the competition. Pedal to victory with up to eight players locally, online, and cross-platform.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Key Features

  • Bike to Victory – Race to the finish on your bikes! With easy-to-pick-up and intuitive controls, everyone can play.
  • Power-Ups – Stay ahead of the competition with power-ups! Lift off with the jetpack, glide safely over threats with the parachute, scatter opponents with mines or stop them in their tracks with honey traps.
  • Blocks and Traps – Build the level together by adding rails, ramps, bouncy pads, speed zones, and other obstacles. Then amp up the difficulty with pendulums, spinning machinery, spikes, and laser-emitting hazards!
  • Sick Tricks – Pull off tricks, do backflips, and wheelies to rack up extra points!
  • Classic Characters – Chicken, Horse, Sheep, and Raccoon return from Ultimate Chicken Horse! Plus a brand-new cast of barnyard buddies.
  • Eight-Player Support – Because four players weren’t enough!
  • Local, Online, and Cross-Platform Multiplayer – Play together on all supported platforms.
  • Custom Level Editor – Build and share your own level designs. Create challenge levels where players compete for the best times, and put together level playlists for a campaign-like experience.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

Announce Trailer

item.title: Annapurna Interactive and Steph Thirion announce minimalist audiovisual game Faraway
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/annapurna-interactive-and-steph-thirion-announce-minimalist-audiovisual-game-faraway

Publisher Annapurna Interactive and developer Steph Thirion have announced Faraway, a procedurally generated audiovisual experience in which where you control a shooting star constantly in the process of vanishing. It will launch for PC via Steam in 2025.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

“I am a shooting star! A spark meant to shine and vanish in a blink. But I will travel! I will mark my trail in every firmament. I will live to see the universe.” Faraway is an immersive, both challenging and chill, procedurally generated audiovisual experience about creating constellations.

Faraway is a single-player game, where you control a shooting star who is constantly in the process of vanishing, but keeping itself alive by harvesting energy from the stars, by creating constellations. Players have to tame the smooth, flowing controls of swinging and slingshotting around stars, while weaving an energy string and connecting it to stars.

Faraway has a randomly generated core mode, and 16 puzzle stages.

In the core mode, every game stars from scratch with a new world that procedurally generates itself in realtime based on the player’s performance, allowing experienced players to catapult themselves quickly to higher scores and higher levels of difficulty. Players have complete freedom on how to shape their constellations, but certain moves – like making loops – yield extra energy and points.

The 16 puzzle stages present new ways to think about the game mechanics and get better at the core mode.

Created single handedly by Steph Thirion, game designer, creative coder and musician, with all visuals being fully generated from scratch in realtime, Faraway is an elegantly minimal-yet-deep game, wrapped in an audiovisual experience that will have players return to it for a long time.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

Announce Trailer

item.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! Early Days Collection full games list announced
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/12/yu-gi-oh-early-days-collection-full-games-list-announced

  • PC
  • Switch

Due out on February 27, 2025.

Konami has launched the Japanese Nintendo eShop page for Yu-Gi-Oh! Early Days Collection, revealing the full list of games included in the collection.

The full list of games is as follows:

  1. Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters (1998 / Game Boy)
  2. Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters II: Dark Duel Stories (1999 / Game Boy, Game Boy Color)
  3. Yu-Gi-Oh! Monster Capsule GB (2000 / Game Boy Color) (New)
  4. Yu-Gi-Oh! Dark Duel Stories (2000 Japan, 2002 United States, 2003 Europe / Game Boy Color)
  5. Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters 4: Battle of Great Duelist (2000 / Game Boy Color / Includes Online Battles Support)
  6. Yu-Gi-Oh! Dungeon Dice Monsters (2001 Japan, 2003 United States, 2003 Europe / Game Boy Advance) (New)
  7. Yu-Gi-Oh! The Eternal Duelist Soul (2001 Japan, 2002 United States, 2003 Europe / Game Boy Advance)
  8. Yu-Gi-Oh Duel Monsters 6, Expert 2 (2001 / Game Boy Advance)
  9. Yu-Gi-Oh! The Sacred Cards (2002 Japan, 2003 United States, 2004 Europe / Game Boy Advance)
  10. Yu-Gi-Oh! Reshef of Destruction (2003 Japan, 2004 United States and Europe / Game Boy Advance)
  11. Yu-Gi-Oh! Worldwide Edition: Stairway to the Destined Duel (2003 / Game Boy Advance) (New)
  12. Yu-Gi-Oh! World Championship Tournament 2004 (2004 / Game Boy Advance)
  13. Yu-Gi-Oh! Destiny Board Traveler (2004 Japan and United States, 2005 Europe / Game Boy Advance)
  14. Yu-Gi-Oh! 7 Trials to Glory: World Championship Tournament 2005 (2004 Japan, 2005 United States and Europe / Game Boy Advance)

Yu-Gi-Oh! Early Days Collection is due out for Switch and PC via Steam on February 27, 2025 worldwide. Read more about the collection here.
